releases.details: Part of the U.N.I.T Files Box Set with The Android Invasion
special_features: Doctor Who Stories: Elisabeth Sladen Part 1

releases.details: Final complete story released by BBC Worldwide on VHS
Upcoming Blu-Ray release of Season 11 will include the story.

notes: Malcolm Hulke's final story as a writer for Doctor Who.
Introduced the Third Doctor's vehicle, the Whomobile.
Part one titled Invasion; parts two to six titled Invasion of the Dinosaurs.
The story reflects real-world political themes and environmental concerns.

real_world_cultural_references: Casablanca reference regarding friendships and political themes.

continuity_notes: Yates' character arc originates from previous appearances in The Green Death.
Events of The Time Warrior lead directly into this story.

plot.plot_summary: The Third Doctor and Sarah arrive in a deserted London plagued by looters and dinosaur attacks. As chaos unfolds, they uncover a sinister plot involving time travel, an underground conspiracy, and the true nature of the dinosaurs' appearance as part of a plan to revert humanity to a primitive state. Ultimately, they confront those who orchestrated the crisis, leading to a resolution that emphasizes the consequences of radical environmentalism.
Part One: The Doctor and Sarah arrive in evacuated London where they encounter looters and are initially imprisoned. They begin to uncover the chaos caused by the appearance of dinosaurs.
Part Two: As the Doctor attempts to understand the situation, soldiers fight a tyrannosaurus. Various plots unfold involving sabotage from within UNIT.
Part Three: The Doctor captures a tyrannosaurus, only to confront conspiracies with treachery from someone within UNIT.
Part Four: Sarah is kidnapped by those involved in the conspiracy who plan to flee Earth aboard a spaceship.
Part Five: The Doctor uncovers the full extent of the conspiracy, leading to a showdown that reveals the intentions behind Operation Golden Age.
Part Six: A climax where the Doctor and his allies face off against the conspirators, ultimately resolving the crisis but questioning the motivation behind their actions.
